meanings.definition: The process in which a cell loses water and shrinks due to osmosis.
meanings.sent1: Plasmolysis can happen when a cell loses too much water.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study plasmolysis to understand how cells react to water loss.
meanings.sent3: The classroom plant had a little plasmolysis after the weekend without watering.
meanings.sent4: The plasmolysis of the grape showed how dehydration affects fruit.
meanings.sent5: The image of plasmolysis in the textbook made the concept clearer to the students.

meanings.definition: The shrinking of a cell due to water loss.
meanings.sent1: After plasmolysis, the cell became smaller in size.
meanings.sent2: The biologist observed plasmolysis under the microscope.
meanings.sent3: The cartoon character experienced plasmolysis when he forgot to drink water.
meanings.sent4: The plasmolysis of the balloon symbolized deflation in the experiment.
meanings.sent5: The video demonstration of plasmolysis captivated the students' attention.
